40#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
41# include "config.h"
42#endif
43
44#include <sys/cdefs.h>
45__RCSID("$NetBSD: pam_error.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:09 christos Exp $");
46
47#include <stdarg.h>
48#include <stdio.h>
49#include <stdlib.h>
50
51#include <security/pam_appl.h>
52#include <security/openpam.h>
53
54#include "openpam_impl.h"
55
56/*
57 * OpenPAM extension
58 *
59 * Display an error message
60 */
61
62int
63pam_error(const pam_handle_t *pamh,
64 const char *fmt,
65 ...)
66{
67 va_list ap;
68 char *rsp;
69 int r;
70
71 va_start(ap, fmt);
72 r = pam_vprompt(pamh, PAM_ERROR_MSG, &rsp, fmt, ap);
73 va_end(ap);
74 FREE(rsp); /* ignore response */
75 return (r);
76}
77
78/*
79 * Error codes:
80 *
81 * !PAM_SYMBOL_ERR
82 * PAM_SYSTEM_ERR
83 * PAM_BUF_ERR
84 * PAM_CONV_ERR
85 */
86
87/**
88 * The =pam_error function displays an error message through the
89 * intermediary of the given PAM context's conversation function.
90 *
91 * >pam_info
92 * >pam_prompt
93 * >pam_verror
94 */
95
